subject: Self Care
title: Replacing Instead of Removing
description: A quick, practical guide to Replacing Instead of Removing.

hook.text: You quit snacking but now you're irritable and fixated. The void demands something. Nature hates a vacuum.

buildup.text: Removing a habit leaves the cue and craving intact. Without a substitute, the old behavior returns.

discovery.text: Successful habit change replaces the routine while keeping the same cue and delivering a similar reward.

twist.text: The replacement doesn't need to be perfect. It just needs to be less harmful and somewhat satisfying.

climax.text: Stressed and craving a cigarette? Try a walk instead. Same cue, different routine, similar relief.

punchline.text: Don't leave a gap. Replace the habit, don't erase it.

quiz.question: Why does simply removing a habit usually fail?
options: The cue and craving remain, pulling you back without a substitute
